meanings.definition: The quality or state of being stolid
meanings.sent1: Her stolidities made it hard to tell what she was feeling.
meanings.sent2: The stolidities of the old man were evident in his unchanging expression.
meanings.sent3: Despite his stolidities, he couldn't hide his excitement when he won the lottery.
meanings.sent4: The weight of her stolidities felt like a heavy burden on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The stolidities of the mountain stood firm against the raging storm.

meanings.sent1: The stolidities of his response surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but chuckle at the stolidities of the cat as it ignored her calls.
meanings.sent3: The stolidities of the robot's movements made it seem almost human.
meanings.sent4: His stolidities in the face of danger were admirable.
meanings.sent5: The stolidities of the tree branches swaying in the wind were mesmerizing.
